item.description:
Cornel West
7pm October 30, 2008
Betty R. Tipton Room
Student Center

Cornel West, the class of 1943 Professor at Princeton University, has been called "one of America's most provocative, public intellectuals". Newsweek herald him as an eloquent prophet with attitude." In his latest book, "Hope on a Tightrope," he offers courageous commentaryu on issues that effect the lives of all Americans. Themes include Race, Leadership, Faith, Famiuly, Philosophy, and Love and Service. His other books include the New York Times bestsellers "Race Matters," which also won the American Book Award, and "Democracy Matters." West has won numerous awards and has recieved more than 20 honorary degrees. He also was an influencial force in developing the storyline for the popular Matrix movie trilogy.

Tickets are $10 each for the general public, free for students. For tickets call (860) 465-0036 or email: tickets@easternct.edu
item.name: Cornel West
